name: fictive
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
invented and not true or not existing: His story is about the residents of a fictive American town. The speech was a combination of fictive and real elements. Synonym
fictitious
relating to writing that is about imaginary characters and events and not based on real people and facts: Narrative doesn't have to be fictive. Bradbury was always fascinated by the experimental fictive techniques of contemporary American novelists. Synonym
fictional
More examplesFewer examplesThe Lily Chou-Chou referred to in the title is a fictive pop star.Consider a fictive country, that we shall name the Un. St. of Am.Your work has been characterized as part fictive, part autobiographical. This alternate history views contemporary issues through a fictive lens.
